Instruction: Melt the butter and apply a small amount to the inside of a 9-inch cake pan using a brush.

In a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, and salt. In another bowl, beat the remaining butter with the granulated sugar until light and fluffy. Add the eggs and vanilla, mixing until well combined. Gradually add the flour mixture and the remaining pineapple juice, alternating between the two, stirring until just combined.
In a separate bowl, whisk together the remaining melted butter, 1/2 cup of pineapple juice, and eggs.
In a separate bowl, cream together the remaining butter, egg yolks, and the white sugar until light and fluffy.
Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the cake comes out clean, about 30 minutes.
Allow the cake to cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then cover the pan tightly with a serving dish and invert it so the pineapple side is facing up.
